content.en: Urinary infection prediction: Researchers have been investigating the use of algorithms to predict the presence or absence of urinary pathogens, reduce the workload of microbiology laboratories, and diagnose urinary tract infections. These algorithms, such as screening algorithms, clinical decision rules, and dipstick decision rules, have shown promise in accurately predicting and managing urinary tract infections. Additionally, automated technologies like urine sediment analyzers and urinalysis analyzers have been developed to quickly and accurately screen urine samples for infections.
content.da: Urininfektionsforudsigelse: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer til at forudsige tilstedeværelsen eller fraværet af urinpatogener, reducere arbejdsbyrden for mikrobiologilaboratorier og diagnosticere urinvejsinfektioner. Disse algoritmer, såsom screeningsalgoritmer, kliniske beslutningsregler og urinstix-beslutningsregler, har vist lovende resultater i præcist at forudsige og håndtere urinvejsinfektioner. Derudover er automatiserede teknologier som urinsedimentanalysatorer og urinanalyseanalysatorer blevet udviklet til hurtigt og præcist at screene urinprøver for infektioner.
